```{r}
# Hackathon (First 4 Graphs)

library(ggplot2)

#Create a data frame with the sales data
sales_data <- data.frame(Fruit = c("Apples", "Oranges"), Quantity = c(25, 30))

#Create a bar chart using ggplot2
bar_chart <- ggplot(sales_data, aes(x = Fruit, y = Quantity)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", fill = "skyblue", width = 0.5) +
  labs(
    title = "Sales of Apples and Oranges",
    x = "Fruit",
    y = "Quantity Sold"
  )

#Display the bar chart
print(bar_chart)

##Create a data frame with the sales data
sales_data <- data.frame(
  Fruit = c("Small Apples", "Medium Apples", "Large Apples", "Small Oranges", "Large Oranges"),
  Quantity = c(10, 15, 20, 8, 25),
  Width = c(0.3, 0.5, 0.7, 0.3, 0.7)  # Specify the widths for each bar
)

```

```{r}
# Create a data frame with the sales data
sales_data <- data.frame(
  Fruit = c("Small Apples", "Medium Apples", "Large Apples", "Small Oranges", "Large Oranges"),
  Quantity = c(10, 15, 20, 8, 25),
  Width = c(0.3, 0.5, 0.7, 0.3, 0.7)  # Specify the widths for each bar
)

# Convert the "Width" column to numeric
sales_data$Width <- as.numeric(sales_data$Width)

# Create a variable-width column chart using ggplot2
variable_width_chart <- ggplot(sales_data, aes(x = Fruit, y = Quantity, width = Width)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", fill = "plum") +
  labs(
    title = "Variable-Width Column Chart",
    x = "Fruit",
    y = "Quantity Sold"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()  # Use a minimal theme for better visibility

# Display the variable-width column chart
print(variable_width_chart)


```

```{r}
# Load the ggplot2 package
library(ggplot2)

# Create a data frame with the sales data, including additional fruits
sales_data <- data.frame(
  Fruit = c("Small Apples", "Medium Apples", "Large Apples", "Small Oranges", "Large Oranges", "Small Bananas", "Large Bananas"),
  Quantity = c(10, 15, 20, 8, 25, 12, 18)
)

# Create a horizontal bar chart using ggplot2
horizontal_bar_chart <- ggplot(sales_data, aes(x = Quantity, y = Fruit)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", fill = "skyblue4") +
  labs(
    title = "Horizontal Bar Chart",
    x = "Quantity Sold",
    y = "Fruit"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()

# Display the horizontal bar chart
print(horizontal_bar_chart)


```
